class.name: Word.PageSetup
class.description: Represents the page setup settings for a Word document or section.

properties.name: bookFoldPrinting
properties.description: Specifies whether Microsoft Word prints the document as a booklet.

examples.description: Enable book fold printing to format the document as a booklet

properties.name: bookFoldPrintingSheets
properties.description: Specifies the number of pages for each booklet.

examples.description: Set up a document for booklet printing with 4 pages per booklet sheet

properties.name: bookFoldReversePrinting
properties.description: Specifies if Microsoft Word reverses the printing order for book fold printing of bidirectional or Asian language documents.

examples.description: Enable reverse printing order for book fold printing to properly print a bidirectional language document

properties.name: bottomMargin
properties.description: Specifies the distance (in points) between the bottom edge of the page and the bottom boundary of the body text.

examples.description: Set the bottom margin of the document to 72 points (1 inch)

properties.name: charsLine
properties.description: Specifies the number of characters per line in the document grid.

examples.description: Set the document grid to display 40 characters per line

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the page setup's request context to verify the connection to the Word host application and log its diagnostic information

properties.name: differentFirstPageHeaderFooter
properties.description: Specifies whether the first page has a different header and footer.

examples.description: Configure the document to use a different header and footer on the first page

properties.name: footerDistance
properties.description: Specifies the distance between the footer and the bottom of the page in points.

examples.description: Set the footer distance to 36 points (0.5 inches) from the bottom of the page

properties.name: gutter
properties.description: Specifies the amount (in points) of extra margin space added to each page in a document or section for binding.

examples.description: Set a 36-point gutter margin for binding on the left side of the document

properties.name: gutterPosition
properties.description: Specifies on which side the gutter appears in a document.

examples.description: Set the gutter position to the top of the page for binding at the top edge of the document

properties.name: gutterStyle
properties.description: Specifies whether Microsoft Word uses gutters for the current document based on a right-to-left language or a left-to-right language.

examples.description: Set the gutter style to right-to-left (bidirectional) for the current document to accommodate Arabic or Hebrew text layout

properties.name: headerDistance
properties.description: Specifies the distance between the header and the top of the page in points.

examples.description: Set the header distance to 36 points (0.5 inches) from the top of the page

properties.name: layoutMode
properties.description: Specifies the layout mode for the current document.

examples.description: Set the document's layout mode to Grid for precise character and line positioning

properties.name: leftMargin
properties.description: Specifies the distance (in points) between the left edge of the page and the left boundary of the body text.

examples.description: Set the left margin of the document to 1 inch (72 points)

properties.name: lineNumbering
properties.description: Specifies a LineNumbering object that represents the line numbers for the PageSetup object.

examples.description: Configure line numbering to restart at 1 on each page with numbers appearing every 5 lines

properties.name: linesPage
properties.description: Specifies the number of lines per page in the document grid.

examples.description: Set the document to display 44 lines per page in the document grid

properties.name: mirrorMargins
properties.description: Specifies if the inside and outside margins of facing pages are the same width.

examples.description: Enable mirror margins for a document so that inside and outside margins are swapped on facing pages for book-style printing

properties.name: oddAndEvenPagesHeaderFooter
properties.description: Specifies whether odd and even pages have different headers and footers.

examples.description: Configure a document to use different headers and footers for odd and even pages

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: Specifies the orientation of the page.

examples.description: Change the page orientation of the active document to landscape mode

properties.name: pageHeight
properties.description: Specifies the page height in points.

examples.description: Set the page height to 792 points (11 inches) for the active document

properties.name: pageWidth
properties.description: Specifies the page width in points.

examples.description: Set the page width to 8.5 inches (612 points) for the active document

properties.name: paperSize
properties.description: Specifies the paper size of the page.

examples.description: Set the document's paper size to A4 format

properties.name: rightMargin
properties.description: Specifies the distance (in points) between the right edge of the page and the right boundary of the body text.

examples.description: Set the right margin of the document to 1 inch (72 points)

properties.name: sectionDirection
properties.description: Specifies the reading order and alignment for the specified sections.

examples.description: Set the section direction to right-to-left for the first section of the document to support languages like Arabic or Hebrew

properties.name: sectionStart
properties.description: Specifies the type of section break for the specified object.

examples.description: Set the section to start on a new page

properties.name: showGrid
properties.description: Specifies whether to show the grid.

examples.description: Show the document grid to help with alignment and layout

properties.name: suppressEndnotes
properties.description: Specifies if endnotes are printed at the end of the next section that doesn't suppress endnotes.

examples.description: Configure the current section to suppress endnotes so they print at the end of the next section that allows them

properties.name: textColumns
properties.description: Gets a TextColumnCollection object that represents the set of text columns for the PageSetup object.

examples.description: Configure the document to use a two-column layout with a 0.5 inch spacing between columns

properties.name: topMargin
properties.description: Specifies the top margin of the page in points.

examples.description: Set the top margin of the document to 1 inch (72 points)

properties.name: twoPagesOnOne
properties.description: Specifies whether to print two pages per sheet.

examples.description: Configure the document to print two pages on one sheet of paper

properties.name: verticalAlignment
properties.description: Specifies the vertical alignment of text on each page in a document or section.

examples.description: Set the vertical alignment of the document to center so that text is vertically centered on each page

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the current page orientation and margins of the active document

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Configure page setup for the document by setting multiple properties including orientation, margins, and paper size at once

methods.name: setAsTemplateDefault
methods.description: Sets the specified page setup formatting as the default for the active document and all new documents based on the active template.

examples.description: Set custom page margins (1 inch top/bottom, 1.5 inch left/right) as the default for all new documents based on the current template

methods.name: togglePortrait
methods.description: Switches between portrait and landscape page orientations for a document or section.

examples.description: Toggle the page orientation of the current document from portrait to landscape (or vice versa)

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.PageSetup object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.PageSetupData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Retrieve page setup settings as a plain JavaScript object and log them to the console for debugging or data export purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a page setup object across multiple sync calls to modify its margins and orientation without encountering InvalidObjectPath errors

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Apply page setup changes to a section and then untrack the PageSetup object to free memory after the modifications are complete.
